column4: I'm having some trouble with xorg and mplayer, i need to enable xv badly but I can't figure out how to.
what happens if you run mplayer with -vo xv  ?
Error opening/initializing the selected video_out (-vo) device.
does "ps auwx|grep mplayer" show anything? sometimes one can get stuck and hodl the xv port open
also you might want to check that "xvinfo" outputs something - ie that you have Xv available
No nothing. And xvinfo says no asapters present.
aha. what graphics card do you have?
It worked fine in a regular ubuntu install, but now I'm trying a server install with xubuntu-desktop, and it isn't now.
I'd check out which driver X is using, you might be in VESA or something
Norfosomo: I realise that, but I wanted a clean install.
I know I'm using vesa, I tried ati but it badly screws up resolutions and such.
well vesa isn't going to do Xv, so you'll need to use something else. I'm not familiar with ATi cards though. Any idea what you were using before?
No, not sure, is there a list I can look at, or maybe the apm driver supports xv?
apm == advanced power management, so no.
So apm will provide nothing that vesa won't? Not even some extra apm support or something? :S
I've never seen the apm support load properly
Well ok but any idea if there's a list I can look at?
